record.description: Planning for the University of Chicago's 75th Anniversary. The University of Chicago is planning a year-long series of scientific and cultural events to observe its 75th Anniversary. The celebration will run from January 1, 1966 to December 31 1966. George W. Beadle, President of the University, said the formal theme of the observance will be titled: Conditions and Purposes of the Modern University. In this photo, representatives of the University's Board of Trustees, Faculty and Administration are shown as they consider plans for the observance. They are (left to right): Edward D. Rosenheim, Jr., Professor in the Department of English, who is chairman of a faculty committee concerned with the anniversary. Mr. Roseinheim resides at 5658 Blackstone Avenue, Chicago. Glen A. Lloyd, Chicago attorney and a trustee of the University. He will serve as Chairman of the Board of Trustee's Anniversary Committee. He resides at Libertyville, Illinois. Charles U. Daly, as Vice President for Public Affairs, has assumed responsibility for administration of the Anniversary Year. He resides at South Greenwood Avenue, Chicago.
